text: I would try using the search endpoint with filters:  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/engagements/tasks#search>
Got it. Thanks a lot.

Do you have any sort of documentation spec on V2 sig auth?
Not sure how secure focused all this is, but a signature should ideally contain a couple more pieces of information:
• one time random salt 
• timestamp
Those things are generally send in the header of the request

It looks like you're using a developer sdk I'm not sure where the problem is, but that's security 101 for sigs

Hello everyone,
Could anyone help me out with something? I’ve spent some time working with API consumption, where requests from external static pages create records in the CRM with custom objects. But now, I’d like to know if it’s possible to set up an API to act as a decoder directly within the CRM. For example, by entering a Zip code in the “State” object, when I click “Create,” the API would automatically populate the address fields by consuming the data through a Private App.
I'm having some trouble figuring out this next step—any tips would be greatly appreciated!
Do you have access to webhooks?
Hi everyone, I have a question about setting up OAuth with a private app. Does anyone know where I can see the Client ID and where I can change the "app's registed redirect URL"?

Hi everyone! Could anybody help me with some topic? I want to get the knowledge articles with analytics properties like the *image 1*. In this case, I want the articles with more visits. I appreciate your help
You can try in the Analytics section, look for a filter or sorting option related to _Visits_ (or _Page Views_). You can also alternatively set up Google Analytics to assist with this.

Hi <@U07TSPRPK4N> private apps only support private <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps#make-api-calls-with-your-app-s-access-token|access tokens>. Interested to learn more about what you are building and who is expected to use in more detail over DM if possible.
Thanks <@U0623BNGR5H>! I looked for a endpoint that get me the articles with more visits, but I see the params to sort data only accepts name and timestamp fields. :worried:

<@U0623BNGR5H> I found a endpoint like that: <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/knowledge-content/v2/analytics/article-health?portalId=47852367&clienttimeout=30000&hs_static_app=knowledge-content-ui&hs_static_app_version=1.67990|https://app.HubSpot.com/api/knowledge-content/v2/analytics/article-health?portalId=4[…]static_app=knowledge-content-ui&hs_static_app_version=1.67990>; but I see this is an intern api.

Yes <@U07TF5ANJRM>, actually unfortunately, HS's API currently doesn’t support sorting directly by "visits" (or page views) as a built-in option.

YET, you can have a workaround to retrieve all articles and sort locally (hectic to be honest).

Did you think of using some tool like Hotjar? I've previously used it and it definitely helps.
Oh! I didn't use that tool before. You comment that it is possible to recover all the items, what endpoint could I use in this case? I found the site search endpoint.

You can use the *CMS Blog Posts API* (but from the screenshot you shared it doesn't seem that the KB is set up as blog posts) or *CMS Pages API* 

`GET /cms/v3/pages` - Sort locally by visits once you've combined the article and analytics data.
You can set `limit`, `after`, and `sort` parameters.
Excellent! Thank so much for your help Ahmed! :heart_hands:
You are most welcome Frank! :orange_heart:

I am looking to create a button on a company contact that calls an endpoint for that company so that we may access their system (with approval) as a way to provide IT support.   A custom action/button on the Contact that will call an API with a JSON payload utilizing information from the contact, then get a URL and open a new tab.
I can help build this for you - Are you open to a paid engagement?
You are going to need a UI Extension which requires at least 1  Enterprise Hub.
Maybe some other opinions can be shared in the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel - looking for additional opinions on the subject.
Hello team, I have a question

We have activated the option that marks all contacts added through the integration as marketing. I want to change this and specify in the request sent to the HubSpot API whether a contact should be marked as marketing.

Is this functionality possible?
